name: Software Safety Game (Iteration 2)
description:
This game is part of an NSF-sponsored research for undergraduates on software safety at UT-Dallas (https://paris.utdallas.edu/reu).

After playing the game, please take the time to fill out the survey:  https://forms.gle/bGFDwTvK8PPPH4rA9. The data from this survey will be used in our final paper/report. The program is ending soon, but I may continue to work on the game after in which case the feedback will go into further developing the game as well. Thank you for participating!

The game serves several, cross-purposes: it will hopefully teach and inspire programmers who play the game to care more about software quality, it is a chance for us to experiment with safety-critical development cycles and testing methods, and it will serve as a repository of important information on software safety.

Please send any inquiries to mlevine@unca.edu.
